industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Market Research, and Telecommunications
description:
IDC is searching for a 
Research Director, Canadian Communications Market Drivers and Strategies
 within our Worldwide Telecommunications and Mobility team.




We are looking for a dynamic individual who is knowledgeable on the Canadian telecommunications industry and the transformation that is taking place within this market. This exciting 
Research Director
 position that will cover the ongoing market, technology, and transformation trends in the Canadian Telecommunications space. This position will be responsible for primary research, report writing, market forecasting, survey creation, and supporting clients for the Canadian Communications Market Drivers and Strategies program at IDC Canada.




The 
Research Director
 will focus on developing an understanding of the competitive landscape, key trends and business requirements within the Canadian telecommunications and services markets, including mobility services, 5G, enterprise WAN, and IoT connectivity services. The ideal candidate will be able articulate the nuances of the Canadian market within the larger global telecommunications industry.




Hallmarks of a successful 
IDC Research Director
 include excellent verbal, written and quantitative analysis skills. This position carries the expectation the individual will author a mix of shorter industry-event reactive pieces, vendor market share and forecast analysis and thought leadership documents that provide deeper insight into the changing nature of the market. The ability to build relationships with vendors and to reach out to industry representatives proactively is critical.





Responsibilities


• Driving new thought leadership and market research on evolution of telecommunications services and market dynamics in Canada

• Identifying market opportunities, new client prospects and effectively working with sales to help win new subscription contracts

• Supporting client inquiry related to research reports and topics pertinent to published thought leadership research

• Working in concert with the worldwide telecommunications team to ensure a holistic view of the telecommunications services landscape

• Working with IDC analysts in other technology domains (e.g., cloud) and regions by identifying and engaging on collaborative research efforts

• Contributing qualitative/quantitative research and thought leadership to consulting projects





Qualifications


• Bachelor's degree, MBA a plus; or equivalent experience

• 10+ years industry knowledge working in product, strategy, or marketing roles

• Industry knowledge on telecommunications services, network infrastructure and enterprise communications solutions

• Ability to collect industry trends, and present the larger transformation story

• Ability to quickly synthesize data from various sources – interviews, surveys, secondary research, and other IDC research

• Strong qualitative and quantitative analysis skills

• A self-starter who can work independently yet has strong collaboration skills to professionally insert oneself into projects in a positive and additive manner

• Comfortable speaking with senior executives and establishing executive-level contacts

• A passion for working in an entrepreneurial environment

• Excellent speaking and writing skills

• Willingness/ability to travel to various events as required for presentations or engaging with customers (20%), post-COVID

• This position is based in Toronto but can be located in an approved remote location in Canada.





Successful applicants for this position must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Requests for reasonable accommodation based on disability or religion will be considered on an individual basis.





About IDC: International Data Corporation (IDC) is the premier global provider of market intelligence, advisory services, and events for the information technology, telecommunications and consumer technology markets. IDC helps IT professionals, business executives, and the investment community make fact-based decisions on technology purchases and business strategy. More than 1,100 IDC analysts provide global, regional, and local expertise on technology and industry opportunities and trends in over 110 countries worldwide. For 50 years, IDC has provided strategic insights to help our clients achieve their key business objectives. IDC is a subsidiary of IDG, the world's leading technology media, research, and events company.






 
IDC Canada is an equal opportunity employer. It is the Company's policy to recruit and select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications, with emphasis on selecting the best qualified person for the job. Applicants must have a valid Canadian Social Insurance Number (SIN) card. Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

Your Challenge


Help bring research to life and drive your career forward with the National Research Council of Canada (NRC), Canada's largest research and technology organization.




We are looking for a Director, Research and Development, to support our Energy, Mining and Environment (EME) Research Centre. The Director, R&D would be someone who shares our core values of Integrity, Excellence, Respect and Creativity.




The Energy, Mining and Environment Research Centre delivers advanced technologies to Canada's energy, mining and environment sectors by transforming scientific discoveries into applications. With staff located at 5 different sites across the country, we apply our multidisciplinary capabilities through strategic R&D programs addressing stakeholder challenges and creating positive impacts for Canada.




The Director, Research and Development (DRD) provides scientific leadership and manages research activities, ensuring alignment with NRC’s objectives. The DRD supports the Director General in developing both employees and business or collaboration opportunities to create long-term sustainability for the organization. Where assigned, manages R&D programs, technical services, facilities, or other internal capabilities in home or other Divisions.




Applying excellent management skills, hands-on leadership, and technological depth, the DRD leads a cadre of 6 group leaders with approximately 70 research and technical staff to achieve optimal execution of projects, resource management, and continuous professional development of staff. The DRD plays a critical role in the EME management team and provides the Director General with crucial and timely advice and ongoing assurance of alignment with strategy, scientific and technical excellence, and client satisfaction. The DRD maximizes the value and impact of EME’s contribution to various NRC R&D programs aimed at Canada’s public policy initiatives. As well, the DRD works extensively with external stakeholders and clients providing research and development to accomplish common goals.





Education


Masters degree in science or engineering from a recognized university in a scientific field relevant to the research areas of EME research centre. A PhD may be considered an asset.




An equivalent combination of experience and education may be considered. 





Experience



In depth scientific experience working in an area related to EME research centre scientific and technological domains, including both supporting and leading the development of programs or projects.

Experience supervising and developing scientific staff in multidisciplinary teams, including in a matrix environment of projects and programs.

Significant and recently demonstrated experience in applying the principles, tools and practices of leadership, administrative, financial, and human resource management.

Experience accessing technology trends and setting research directions in application areas relevant to EME technologies.

Significant experience with demonstrated success in developing partnership or business opportunities with industry, academia, government or other partnerships; demonstrating highly-effective interpersonal skills.

NRC.NRCHiring-EmbaucheCNRC.CNRC@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca

Votre défi


Contribuez à la réalisation de travaux de recherche stratégiques et poursuivez une carrière prometteuse au Conseil national de recherches du Canada (CNRC), la plus grande organisation de recherche et de technologie au Canada.




Nous souhaitons embaucher un Directeur ou une Directrice, Recherche et développement en vue de soutenir le Centre de recherche en Énergie, Mines et Environnement. La personne choisie doit partager nos valeurs fondamentales relatives à l’intégrité, à l’excellence, au respect et à la créativité.




Le Centre de recherche sur l'énergie, les mines et l'environnement (EME) fournit des technologies de pointe aux secteurs canadiens de l'énergie, des mines et de l'environnement en transformant des découvertes scientifiques en applications industrielles. Grâce à son effectif multidisciplinaire réparti dans 5 différents sites au Canada, il exécute des programmes de R-D stratégique orientés sur les défis des intervenants et sur la création de retombées positives pour le Canada.




Le Directeur ou la directrice, Recherche et développement (DRD) assure le leadership scientifique et gère les activités de recherches, assurant ainsi l’harmonisation avec les objectifs du CNRC. Le/la DRD soutient la Directrice générale dans le développement des employés et des opportunités commerciales ou de collaboration pour créer une durabilité à long terme pour l'organisation. Le cas échéant, gère les programmes de R&D, les services techniques, les installations ou d'autres capacités internes au sein de sa propre division ou dans d'autres divisions.




En appliquant d’excellentes compétences de gestionnaire, une expérience pratique de leadership et une profondeur technologique, la personne choisie dirigera un groupe de 6 chefs d’équipe avec environ 70 membres du personnel de recherche et technique pour accomplir l’exécution optimale des projets, la gestion des ressources et le perfectionnement professionnel continu du personnel. Elle jouera un rôle essentiel au sein de l’équipe de gestion du Centre de recherche EME et fournira à la directrice générale des conseils critiques et opportuns ainsique l’assurance continue de l’alignement avec la stratégie, de l’excellence scientifique et technique et de la satisfaction du client. Elle maximisera la valeur et l’impact de la contribution de EME à divers programmes de recherche et développement du CNRC visant les initiatives de politique publique du Canada. 




En outre, la personne choisie travaillera largement avec des intervenants externes et des clients en effectuant de la recherche et développement ou réaliser des objectifs communs. 





Études


Maîtrise en sciences ou en ingénierie d'une université reconnue dans un domaine scientifique en rapport avec les domaines de recherche du centre de recherche EME. Un doctorat peut être considéré comme un atout.




Une combinaison équivalente d’études et d’expérience peut également être prise en compte.





Expérience



Expérience scientifique approfondie dans un domaine lié aux axes scientifiques et technologiques du centre de recherche EME, y compris le soutien et la direction de l’élaboration de programmes ou de projets.

Expérience de la supervision et du perfectionnement du personnel scientifique au sein d’équipes multidisciplinaires, y compris dans un environnement matriciel de projets et de programmes.

Expérience appréciable et récemment éprouvée de l’application des principes, des outils et des pratiques de leadership, de gestion administrative, financière et des ressources humaines.

Expérience de l’analyse des tendances technologiques et de l’établissement d’orientations de recherche dans des domaines d’application pertinents pour les technologies de EME.

Location:

About Us



The Weston Family Foundation is a family-led charitable foundation that focuses on creative solutions in the areas of healthy aging and healthy ecosystems with the objective of delivering measurable impacts to the well-being of Canadians. Since its inception more than 60 years ago, the Foundation has provided $520 million in charitable grants and today is one of Canada’s largest private charitable foundations.



Job Description




Program Director, Northern




About The Foundation



At the Weston Family Foundation (formerly The W. Garfield Weston Foundation), more than 60 years of philanthropy has taught us that there’s a relationship between healthy landscapes and healthy people. That’s why we champion world-class health research and innovation with the same passion that we support initiatives to protect and restore biodiversity on our unique landscapes. We take a collaborative approach to philanthropy, working alongside forward-thinking partners to advance Canada and create lasting impacts. We aspire to do more than provide funding, as we enable others to find transformational ways to improve the well-being of Canadians.


The Role


The Program Director, Northern is responsible for helping to develop and execute the strategy of the Foundation’s Northern Committee (a committee comprised of a subset of Directors of the Board). He/she/they works in support of the Northern Committee members, to aid in their exploration of opportunities, to design and manage the Committee’s grant-making, measurement, reporting, adjudication etc. as needed. The Program Director is the primary relationship manager with the internal Northern Committee and external grantees (individuals, organizations etc.) that receive Foundation funding. He/she/they will support the Northern Committee in the development of their strategic goals and the alignment of their goals and activities against outcomes of the Landscapes Pillar.

As a member of the Foundation’s leadership team, the role reports to the Executive Director of the Foundation but works very closely in a dotted line reporting relationship to the Chair of the Northern Committee. It is expected that the Program Director will use the best practices and approaches set forth by the Foundation’s leadership team to position the Committee in strong internal and external standing. The Program Director preferably holds an advanced degree in a sub-field of Northern natural science research. An expertise in northern ecosystems and biodiversity is considered a strong asset. He/she/they brings a strong acumen and knowledge of the opportunities, challenges, stakeholders, Northern ecosystems, research efforts and communities encompassed by Canada’s unique North. He/she/they brings several years of leadership experience working in the research and innovation environment or the charitable/Not for profit sector, ensuring research and grant-making are done to the highest standard. Working very closely with the Committee Chair and other members of the Committee, the Program Director uses his/her/their understanding and acumen of Northern landscapes to bring sound judgement, help uncover new opportunities and recommend ideas in support of the Northern Committee’s priorities and vision. The Program Director also helps to bridge the Northern Committee with the over-arching goals of the Landscapes Pillar of the Foundation.

The Program Director also works with the broader Foundation team to ensure best practices are employed in monitoring and evaluation, communication and reporting of key activities.



Key Responsibilities




Relationship Management


Primary relationship manager to the Northern Committee, working closely with the Committee Chair to;


prioritize discussions of the Committee to align with planning and decision-making cycles of the Committee, Pillar, Board and Foundation

develop agendas

develop high-level briefing notes, memos for the Committee Chair

Guide discussions to support decision-making


Primary relationship manager with prospective and current grantees of the Northern Committee to manage expectations, provide clear guidelines, provide advice, raise concerns or awareness, celebrate successes etc.

By drawing on over five decades of experience and expertise in behavioral science, we build communities in order to deliver wellness for all.



Role Overview



Are you passionate about the user’s experience?

Do you want to help lead a dynamic team working to answer challenging questions and to create products aimed at making the world a healthier place?

If you answered yes to these questions, we want to talk with you!

WW is currently looking to hire an Experience Research Manager to help lead our team of 3-4 researchers. Part of the larger WW Product Design Team, the Experience Research team is a close-knit group of practitioners on a quest to understand and advocate for 
what people need

and why
 throughout their health and wellness journey. We use qualitative research methods to provide actionable information to designers (both UX and service), product managers, and more.

The Experience Research Manager role is a blended one. Part of your time will be spent leading research, and part of your time will be spent building the team, helping them develop their craft and instituting and/or improving processes for high impact results.

The Health & Wellness space is growing exponentially, and as a research leader here, your work will have an immediate, meaningful impact on the lives of our customers across the globe.



Research Responsibilities



 Lead research for high impact, ambiguous problem spaces


 Partner with PMs and Designers to frame and prioritize problems to solve based on data 

 Determine the objectives, research plan and tools (interview guides, etc) for research projects with input from key partners 

 Collect insights about the people within the WW community (customers, prospective customers, coaches, etc.) through a variety of methods, whether it be contextual interviews, concept tests, usability tests, diary studies, ethnographic observations, or a new method you invent 

 Translate research findings into actionable insights and/or design tools (e.g., personas, design principles, design considerations, etc.) 


 Effectively communicate at all levels of the organization; using storytelling to advocate for customer needs and influence direction/decisions 

 Collaborate with other teams (e.g., Analytics, Behavioral Science, etc.) to triangulate quantitative and qualitative data to better understand and describe customer behavior 

 Collaborate with smart, passionate researchers, designers and WW partners in various locations around the world 




Management Responsibilities




 Establish strong relationships that build trust across design, product, engineering, and business partners / SME’s 

 Evolve research processes and best practices to provide both efficiency and effectiveness across WW’s many initiatives. 

 Prioritize competing needs and align people and resources accordingly. Advocate for additional resources if necessary. 

 Unlock potential by evaluating and developing team members, helping them hone their craft and maximize their effectiveness/impact 

 Effectively leverage leadership techniques to motivate, guide, and inspire your direct reports 

 Model the way, demonstrating passion for the customer and the ability to empathize with those seeking support for health and weight management /wellness-related issues 




Requirements




 BA/BS degree in Human Factors, HCI, Cognitive Science, Psychology, Anthropology, a related field or equivalent practical experience 

 5-7 years experience conducting user research through methods such as semi-structured interviews, field research, in-person or remote usability tests 

 An established leader, with a minimum of 2-4 years experience managing people. Bonus points for previously working at a mission-driven organization. 

 Expert at asking questions and actively listening; able to hear/uncover what’s not being said 

 Strong communicator, expressing findings and insights through whatever means necessary to tell the story 

 Passionate learner, dedicated to the craft of research and its various methodologies 

 Strong leader and coach who fosters independence 

 Skilled in providing, and loves receiving, actionable feedback (positive and constructive) 

 Strong understanding of, and ability to articulate, the advantages and disadvantages of different research methods, and are able to effectively apply methods appropriately during the product development process. 

 Value collaboration, communication, diversity, and inclusivity; recognize that experience comes in many forms 

 Proven ability to build, manage, and mentor high-performing teams 


Please be prepared to share 2-3 examples of projects you’ve worked on in a research and/or management capacity

Job Summary



This position is responsible for high level research management and leadership of the Reproductive Infectious Disease research team, located at BC Women’s Hospital, reporting to Dr. Deborah Money. Along with a number of longer-standing studies, the team is contributing to the Canadian pandemic response with a suite of projects designed to understand the impact of COVID-19 on pregnant people and their infants.

The Senior Project Manager will be integral in overseeing multiple on-going research studies, and will contribute to strategic planning for the Reproductive Infection Disease Research Program, including supporting future funding applications. The Senior Project Manager would be responsible for aligning the team to build out future research opportunities by supporting researchers in identifying funding sources and overseeing the development of their proposals, budgets and funding applications, work plans and timelines. The Senior Project Manager will also make professional decisions and recommendations on most aspects of existing research work and will be responsible for the quality of research activities, human resource management, and financial management.

This position will be located at BC Women’s hospital, Vancouver BC.


Organizational Status


This position will report directly to Dr Deborah Money, who holds is a Professor at UBC and leads the Reproductive Infectious Diseases (RID) program. This position will manage and directly supervise managers, coordinators, assistants, students and volunteers. This individual will work closely with other research and administrative staff in the Department of OBGYN, at WHRI, and other research institutes across Canada. This individual will also work closely with UBC and PHSA employees. The nature of the work requires independent action and judgment with Dr. Money’s oversight.


Work Performed



Provides leadership and strategic direction to the research team in collaboration with the Principal Investigator.

Supervises and provides direction to research development staff, contractors and student hires including designing and implementing staff orientation resources and training staff Supervises and provides direction to research development staff on financial planning, management, and monitoring of all multi-million dollar study budgets. Ensures responsible financial practices in accordance with both the written UBC policies governing grant management, and the study funders.

Provides authoritative information on University, Faculty and funding agency administrative processes

Provides leadership, direction, facilitates and manages multi-recipient research collaboration across institutions, participates in research excellence recommendations, human resources management, and strategic planning.

Develops relationships with granting agencies, academic, research, professional organizations, and government stakeholders such as policy makers, community leaders/organizers, Indigenous leaders. Provides direction and leadership regarding political, cultural, financial or attitudinal barriers to achieving study objectives.

Plans and manages a large number of developing research proposals,works with the team to assist with exploring and identifying funding sources and developing funding applications. Develops and writes research proposals and submits proposals to funding organizations. Develops research project budget and prepares reports for funding agencies. Also, meets with funding agencies for updates and resolving issues.

Ensures that grants are completed and that sub-grantees fulfill contract deliverables annually, including budget targets, timeline targets, and project activity targets.

Oversees the research team to ensure appropriate keeping of research records (protocols, data and back-up of this information). Keep these essential documents in a safe and secured place. Manages all source documents to be available upon request.

Recruits and interviews the job candidates (Research assistants, research coordinators, research managers, summer students, co-op students, flex students and professional consultants).

Oversees all aspects of human resources management including supervising, mentoring, training, managing and evaluating the research managers, research coordinators, research assistants and technicians, staff and students. Analyzes and outlines the human resource needs of the research team inclusive of initiating, increasing or decreasing of staffing levels based on the project needs.

Provides expertise on a wide range of research areas.



Consequence of Error/Judgement


The Senior Project Manager will exercise vision, direction, professional judgment, initiative, and cultural and political sensitivity in the leadership of the Reproductive Infectious Diseases Research Program. The incumbent is required to conduct all activities in an ethical manner. Patient confidentiality must be respected when dealing with research data. Errors made could cause the ethics approval to be withdrawn, which would stop the project. Errors could influence the ability of research staff to meet critical deadlines, as well as compromise the results of the research project, and therefore affect the credibility of the investigators and the Department. As data and results may be disseminated to other research partners; their results, credibility, and ability to secure more funding could be negatively influenced. Poor decisions may be damaging to the reputation of the university and cause financial loss.


Supervision Received


This position reports directly to Dr. Deborah Money. It will provide direction and will oversee performance and results of the studies within the Reproductive Infectious Disease research program. This position works very independently and has considerable latitude. The Senior Project Manager will be expected to develop a work plan and timelines and exercise a considerable amount of judgement and initiative in duties and supervisory responsibilities.


Supervision Given


The Senior Project Manager will supervise staff and/or support colleagues in community-based partner organizations, Research Managers, Research Assistants, Research Coordinators. In conjunction with postdoctoral fellow and junior faculty will also supervise summer students, co-op students, undergraduate students and volunteers to ensure that the goals of various projects are met in a timely and efficient manner.



Minimum Qualifications



For research project leadership, a post-graduate degree or an equivalent professional designation is required with a minimum of five years of related experience, including experience in a field of specialization, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Otherwise, an undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline is required with a minimum of seven years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.



Preferred Qualifications



Graduate degree in science is preferred; Masters in health sciences is ideal. Experience in clinical research and national/international project management, including established grant and peer review publication record experience. Ability to maintain accuracy and attention to detail. Ability to analyze and interpret data, determine implications, and provide recommendations. Ability to work effectively independently and in a team environment. Ability to analyze problems, identify key information and issues, and effectively resolve issues. Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing.

As a member of the Strategic Insights and Risk Team, the Manager, Strategic Planning works with the Director, Strategic Planning & Risk to deliver analyses and insights around our current and future asset classes in support of the company strategic planning process and progress monitoring, as well as the Corporate Responsibility program. The role is important in uncovering and evaluating opportunities that drive growth and value, providing strategic advice and insight on major issues affecting, or likely to affect, the portfolio of various assets across the organization especially given CF’s constantly evolving strategy and asset mix. This role collaborates with various internal departments, at all levels of management, including Operations, Investments, Development, Data & Innovation, and Legal to create and execute strategic planning.

The Strategic Insights and Risk Team (SI&R) is part of CF’s Finance Group, and is an innovative corporate strategy group composed of 3 key areas:


Strategic Planning & Risk (SP&R) includes strategic plan development, monitoring and related insights, oversight for Corporate Responsibility (CR), and Enterprise Risk Management (ERM)

Strategic Initiatives (SI) includes development of portfolio and asset class strategies and tactics to support decision-making and enable strategic execution

Research & Insights (R&I) conducts proprietary research and analysis to support decision-making across domestic & international markets, leveraging customers and tenant insights, as well as internal and external demographic, traffic and sales data.





What you will deliver:

 

Work with the Director, Strategic Planning & Risk to facilitate the strategic & annual planning process through:


the collection of key organizational metrics that help monitor progress against the CF corporate strategic plan

a regular business environment refresh to help support, enhance, or adjust the current strategic plan

support as needed the annual corporate and department objective setting process

additional analyses and insights to support CF’s strategic plan development and monitoring 


Work with the Director, Strategic Planning & Risk to facilitate the Corporate Responsibility Program management, related insights and positioning in the market, and look for opportunities to evolve the program across all relevant CF platforms by:


providing insights, industry trends and best practices that will inform defining, execution, and refresh of the corporate responsibility strategy

collaborating closely with business leads and other members of the planet, communities, people, partner areas of focus to support defining initiatives, near and long term targets, and resolve issues or interdependencies that could impede execution

monitoring best industry practices and peer strategies to help assess company’s corporate responsibility strategy as well as its near and long-term targets

synthesizing progress for senior management updates


Work with the Manager, Enterprise Risk to ensure alignment across strategic monitoring programs - i.e. ensuring ERM and Corporate Responsibility planning is integrated with and aligned to all facets of strategic planning as appropriate. 

Support the above programs with proactive & reactive research, analysis, and insights that facilitate the delivery of CF’s strategic plan especially as it applies to the evolving future of all current and planned CF asset types. This could include analyses regarding growth opportunities, evolving asset type-specific trends, evolving corporate and social responsibility direction, new innovation concepts, and business model impacts from industry changes and new trends. To create these insights you will need to:


translate high-level project requirements into an outline of required research and analyses to satisfy the project’s deliverables; establish work plans, monitor progress against goals, and conduct status updates with the Director of Strategic Planning & Business Insights to adjust approaches as required

manage the day-to-day delivery of project/analysis insights, including scope definition, priority setting, research, analysis, insight synthesis, report creation and communication. 

develop and manage financial models as they relate to scenario analyses, pilot concepts, and business model impacts

provide reliable and timely interpretation of analysis and financial models that is synthesized for various levels of decision makers, including senior management and the executive team


Support the facilitation of brainstorming workshops within the team and other CF department participants, often senior management as well as the executive team where needed to support strategic decisions

Collaborate with project team members from across the business to gain input on approach, analyses, and the feasibility of recommendations, as well as outline possible pilot approaches and/or rollout plans for further evaluation

Stay current on, and proactively share new industry trends or disruptors in commercial real estate across all asset classes, geographies and innovation concepts that CF currently owns and operates in or ones that may be future opportunities, and technology advances/changes impacting these industries and markets

Prepare and present memoranda and presentations for senior management, including the executive team

Demonstrated business expertise to ensure that high-quality results, insights and objective recommendations are provided to senior stakeholders on a timely and proactive basis that will impact the formulation of organizational strategies

Solid interpersonal skills and proven track record of influencing, excellent verbal and written communication, naturally curious and confident 

Solid critical thinking and problem solving skills with the ability to fuse insightful thinking with disciplined execution to achieve innovative, industry-leading ideas and strategies

Rigorous analytical capabilities to ensure accurate, concise, and timely deliverables

Ability to thrive in a team environment inspiring collaboration and thoughtful debate

A motivated self-starter attitude with a strong work ethic and a high level of attention to detail

Strong organizational and prioritization skills 

Ability to work independently, multi-task and manage priorities in a demanding and continually changing fast-paced environment, often with multiple or competing deadlines

Exhibits an excitement to try new things, a strong action orientation, decisiveness, and inquisitiveness about new opportunities for the future

An undergraduate or post-graduate degree in Business/Commerce or Real Estate

.

At their best in a highly interactive environment with a wide variety of team members

description:
Taking care of our environment has never been more important than it is today. The Nature Conservancy of Canada (NCC) is looking for an enthusiastic Donor Relations and Engagement Officer to join our Saskatchewan Region, a team committed to conserving natural spaces today, and for generations to come. 




NCC is the nation’s leading not-for-profit, private land conservation organization, working to protect our most important natural areas and the species they sustain. Since 1962 NCC and its supporters have protected 14 million hectares (more than 35 million acres) of ecologically significant land across Canada. NCC takes a collaborative, science-based approach to achieve conservation success for the sake of nature and Canadians. With a national office in Toronto and seven regional offices across the country, NCC delivers results you can walk on.

 



Position Summary



With the goal of growing NCC’s community of supporters, the successful candidate will help us deliver a comprehensive donor relations, stewardship, and engagement program. The primary objective of this position is to provide comprehensive donor relations support to the Saskatchewan development team, with a focus on fundraising support, effective database management and reporting, event support and donor stewardship efforts. 

The successful candidate will also be the main contact and relationship builder for leadership giving donors ($1k-$10k), focused on providing this cohort with great donor experiences. The incumbent will be the regional lead for solicitation strategies with the National Integrated Marketing & Development team to enhance and grow revenue and current and prospective donors in Saskatchewan’s leadership giving pool.









Responsibilities






﻿





Donor Relations & Fundraising Support (50%) 



Support a culture in the SK region focused on donor relations and stewardship, such that all activities and systems support service excellence with the donor base.

Responsible for donor recognition and stewardship products (e.g., thank you letters, donor recognition lists, and working with the Communications Manager to support the creation and distribution of the annual impact report, etc.). 

Create, implement, and evaluate strategies that support the development team and lead to sound donor cultivation, recognition, and stewardship, including supporting National donor relations, stewardship, engagement, and events programs where needed. 

Work with the Engagement Manager in the delivery of donor engagement activities and outreach initiatives. 

Responsible for the tracking of donor relationships in Raiser’s Edge for the SK development team and working with the national development operations team, assisting with prospect research and prospect management needs. 

Maintain thorough and accurate database records and with the national development operations team, creating fundraising reports and other database reports as needed. 

Process departmental gifts and acknowledgement letters by using data from Raisers’ Edge to complete the development portion of revenue forms for review by the regional finance team and the Director of Development and to draft acknowledgement letters for development staff to share with donors. 

Provide database support to senior management staff for committee/board and team meetings, including data collecting, document creation, donor research and donor prep. 


 

 
Leadership Annual Giving (20%) 



The Donor Relations & Engagement Coordinator will be the primary relationship holder with SK's leadership annual donor pool ($1k-$10k) and is responsible for the in-person cultivation and stewardship of these donors, aimed at deepening donors' relationships with the organization to increase giving and foster planned/estate gifts. 

Support the solicitation efforts of SK's leadership annual donor pool ($1k-$10k) by working with the national integrated marketing and fundraising team, acting as the lead contact in coordinating content and information needed for appeals. 






Engagement & Events Support (20%) 



Supporting the Engagement Manager, in consultation with the development team and conservation staff, in brainstorming creative and impactful donor engagement opportunities through a variety of delivery vehicles (events, property tours, videos, virtual events and social media outreach, reports, etc.). 

Assist with coordination of campaign, donor cultivation, and other special events logistics. 

Assist with the planning of donor receptions. 

Assist with the planning of volunteer events and attend volunteer events to cultivate donor relationships. 


 


Grants Support (10%) 



Support an operational plan for management of grants across the province and coordinate the plan with conservation and development staff. 

Gather conservation staff-written content for grant applications and support application submission. 

Establish checks and balances on grant outcomes with conservation and development staff and senior management. 

Coordinate with staff and senior management to ensure grant deadlines and reporting outcomes are managed with precision and care and are met on time and on-budget. 

Coordinate grant reports in consultation with conservation staff, finance and the development and communications team, and to ensure submission within defined deadlines. 







Position Requirements




Post-secondary education with university-level preferred. Certificate or training in development / charitable or fundraising-related field is an asset.

3 years minimum experience in a fundraising-related role.

Exceptional verbal and written communications skills.

Excellent customer service skills.

Proficient with Raiser’s Edge or similar fundraising database.

Project management skills with a demonstrated ability to prepare and manage timelines, goals and expectations wisely.

High level of attention to detail.

Proficiency in MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint.

A demonstrated awareness of conservation issues in Saskatchewan and a passion for nature.

Ability to work and travel within a flexible schedule, including occasional weekends and evenings.

A valid driver’s license.


 


How to Apply


NCC is an equal opportunity employer. If you are interested in joining our team, please submit your cover letter and resume through our Career Centre. 
Please indicate in your cover letter why you wish to work with NCC and your interest in conservation and the outdoors.



Deadline: March 11th, 11:59 pm EST 






Salary Range: 
$52,130.00 To 63,610.00 Annually


Position details:
 Full time, permanent




NCC welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.




We value and incorporate diverse traditions, heritage, knowledge and experiences in our mission and in our workplaces. We celebrate the full participation of people from all walks of life as we work towards common goals. We strive for a conservation movement in which equity, diversity and inclusion are the norm. This is our continuous commitment: to promote healthy people, healthy communities and a healthy planet for everyone.





Please note that in-person office attendance, carpooling with co-workers to NCC properties or events, and in-person attendance at any indoor events are currently restricted to staff who are fully vaccinated against the COVID-19 virus. Accordingly, if you are required to participate in any of these activities as part of your job the expectation is that you must be fully vaccinated. Fully vaccinated means you have received two doses of the Pfizer, Astra Zeneca or Moderna vaccine or combination of, and have received the second dose at least two weeks prior to your start date or you have received one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine at least two weeks prior to your start date.

INTERNAL/EXTERNAL

Administration

Executive Assistant

Wage: $27.21 – $30.62 per hour

Full Time: 37.5 hours per week

Permanent


Archway Community Services has been helping people since 1969. We provide more than 90 programs and services to clients at every stage of life. Our vision for the future is justice, opportunities and equitable access for all. We strive toward that goal by fostering community well-being and social justice through positive action and leadership. Come help us help people.

We offer a competitive benefit package that includes extended health and dental as well as a pension plan. Archway was recently recognized as a top 5 finalist in the 2021 Charity Village Best Non-profit Employer – Workplace Mental Health (20+ staff).



Job Summary



The Executive Assistant is the key point person/liaison between the Executive Director and the agency including the Leadership team, the Board of Directors, and staff. The role includes managing the Executive Director’s schedule and email, planning and preparing for committees and meetings and oversees and coordinates the work of the program’s Administrative Assistant. The Executive Assistant also supports the governance work of the Board of Directors and the Leadership team as required.



Responsibilities




Manages administrative tasks such as coordination of meetings, invitations, agendas, and taking minutes.

Manages the Executive Director’s correspondence including emails, correspondence to clients, phone messages, etc., and ensures follow up or forwarding to the appropriate person for follow up.

Prepares reports, memos, presentations, and other documents using Office 365 and Prezi.

Records minutes and disseminates information in an accurate and timely manner.

Coordinates the Executive Director’s schedule, appointments, and travel arrangements.

Communicates with the Executive Director on a daily basis to debrief ongoing and upcoming tasks and track changes.

Schedules and organizes Board, Leadership, and other meetings.

Arranges all aspects of Board and Leadership team meetings, including coordinating and arranging supplies, food, and venue for meetings and events, and setting up meeting space.

Ensures all necessary equipment, rooms, and supplies, etc. are available for meetings and in working order prior to the meeting.

Prepares and/or edits internal and external correspondence.

Compiles and distributes materials to the Board of Directors.

Acts as the Board of Directors’ Secretary ensuring all Board Society Fillings are complete and filed.

Maintains consistent communication with the Board President.

Provides direction and feedback to the Administrative Assistant including providing feedback, dividing work, and completing performance reviews.

Conducts research and compiles data/information related to the agency’s work.

Works with the Executive Director to proactively develop processes and systems to ensure efficiencies for the Executive Director and the Leadership team.

Purchases and/or picks up supplies, food, coffee, or other activities outside the office as required.

Participates in performance management including coaching, feedback, and performance evaluations.

Represents the agency in the community in a professional and knowledgeable manner.

Other duties as assigned.




Education



Requirements and Qualifications


Maintain a Satisfactory Criminal Records Check.

Post Secondary Certificate in Business Administration, Office Administration or a related field is an asset.

Valid BC Driver’s License




Experience




A minimum of 5 years’ experience in an administrative role.

A minimum of 2 years’ experience supporting an Executive.

A minimum of 1 year experience in a supervisory role.



Knowledge and Skill Set



Well-developed knowledge of office procedures and practices.

Strong computer competency, able to use Microsoft Office 365 particularly Word, Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint as well as virtual meeting platforms including Microsoft Teams, 

Able to type 60 WPM with a high degree of accuracy.

Strong written, verbal, and active listening skills able to communicate respectfully and effectively with people from a variety of backgrounds.

Coachable, open to new learning and new ideas.

Able to clearly communicate ideas for continuous improvement.

Strong service orientation.

Strong planning, organizing, and time management skills; able to manage competing priorities and meet deadlines.

Well-developed ability to switch-task in a busy environment.

Able to use critical thinking to solve unexpected problems.


WORKING CONDITIONS


Available to work flexible hours including early mornings, evenings, and some weekends as required.

Interruptions are common, a well-developed ability to switch-task in a busy environment is important.

This position requires in-person social interaction, requiring adherence to COVID-19 safety protocols.

This position may include long periods of being seated.

This position includes picking up supplies, requiring access to a reliable vehicle
